law.catch_line: A Board of Directors shall manage the Corporation and exercise its powers....

text.section: A Board of Directors shall manage the Corporation and exercise its powers.

The Board consists of the following 12 members:
as ex officio voting members:
the Secretary; and
the Secretary of Transportation; and
the following members, appointed by the Governor with the advice and consent of the Senate:
two representatives of local government;
three members who are knowledgeable in real estate or commercial financing;
three members who are knowledgeable in industrial development or industrial relations; and
two members of the general public.
Each member of the Board shall be a resident of the State.
In appointing Board members, the Governor shall consider geographic diversity and minority representation.

section.section: The term of an appointed member is 4 years.
The terms of the appointed members are staggered as required by the terms provided for members of the Board on October 1, 2008.
At the end of a term, a member continues to serve until a successor is appointed and qualifies.
A member who is appointed after a term has begun serves only for the rest of the term and until a successor is appointed and qualifies.

text.section: Before taking office, each member appointed to the Board shall take the oath required by Article 1, § 9 of the Maryland Constitution.
